title: ChatGPT won't enjoy same protection under Section 230 as social media, expert says
description: Unlike Meta and Twitter, ChatGPT may be found by the courts to in fact "develop" content, stripping it of the protection against liability of Section 230 of the US Communications Decency Act.

title: The Nixplay Touch 10 digital photo frame is actually pretty sweet
description: As a millennial who never prints photos, seeing memories that have been buried in my phone for years suddenly on display in my living room is so nice. I can't recommend the Nixplay Touch 10 enough, and it's currently $70 off.

title: Amazon's latest TVs can now stream straight into hearing implants
description: Amazon's new feature enables Fire TVs to connect to Cochlear brand implants, delivering high-quality TV sound for people with hearing loss.

title: 3 hidden Samsung Galaxy camera features you should be using
description: Samsung's kitchen sink approach to features carries over to its camera app, where the most useful tools are hidden in plain sight.

title: How to install this project management tool on your home network
description: If you'd like to keep your data, files, and projects managed within the safety and privacy of your home network, read on and find out how.

title: Neo QLED vs OLED: Which technology is right for you?
description: TV acronyms have gotten so complex shoppers are probably longing for the days when the only choice was plasma or LCD. We're going to demystify the differences between the two popular Neo QLED and OLED technologies to help you decide which is best for you.

title: Samsung's 2-in-1 Galaxy Book is a great but frustrating laptop
description: Review: Samsung's Galaxy Book 3 Pro 360 checks most of the boxes that make for a great two-in-one laptop, but as on its phones, Samsung's software can get in the way.

title: 3 hidden Samsung camera features you're not using enough (if at all)
description: Samsung's kitchen sink approach to features carries over to its camera app, where the most useful tools are hidden in plain sight.

title: Google Pixel's magical camera feature is finally coming to iPhones (and other Android phones)
description: Magic Eraser is arguably Google's most highly-touted camera feature of recent years. Now, iPhone users can get in on the action, as long as they meet one requirement.

title: How to create a LibreOffice template
description: Simplify your daily workflow with LibreOffice templates, so you don't have to re-create the same document over and over.

title: These experts are racing to protect AI from hackers. Time is running out
description: AI is becoming a key part of our lives. Hacking it could cause chaos, so the race is on to build defenses.

title: Apple takes key step towards bringing blood glucose tracking to its Apple Watch
description: Apple Watch could in future gain one more health feature: monitoring blood glucose levels.

title: NSA says: Do these things to keep your home network safe from cyber attack
description: The NSA's Best Practices for Securing Your Home Network guide provides remote workers with advice on how to protect against online threats.

title: Samsung Galaxy S23: This new feature creates an AI version of your voice to respond to calls
description: This feature, currently available in Korean, can synthesize a voice to respond to what users write.

title: This 'lapdock' kit turns an open-source smartphone into a laptop
description: Purism has unveiled its vision for convergence with the Librem 5 smartphone and an intriguing docking station.

title: Microsoft researchers are using ChatGPT to instruct robots and drones
description: Microsoft's next challenges for ChatGPT are being a tool for human-to-robot interactions and generating code for robotic actions.
